author: Jennifer Thomas
title: Bold women take stage at Charlotte brewery
text:
Photos 
Owner and founder Carol Waggener says Bold Missy’s goal is to create well-loved beers, while giving a nod to women — particularly those who have accomplished great things. Beer names look to incorporate Bold Missy’s from music, movies, history or politics. 
But don’t expect the brewery to take itself too seriously. Expect a light-hearted and fun atmosphere, she adds. 
“We take our beer seriously. We love woman. We love everybody,” says Lybbi Roth , taproom manager. 
Adds Waggener: “It’ll be a fun destination.” 
Bold Missy Brewery hopes to begin pouring those brews sometime in April. 
Construction continues on that 8,600-square-foot brewery located at 610 Anderson St. in the Charlotte neighborhood known as NoDa. That spot — formerly a cabinet shop— is located near a light-rail stop going into service in August. 
It will be Charlotte’s first brewery owned solely by a female. 
“Charlotte in general is still really underrepresented in craft beer. I think there’s a lot of room for different perspectives,” Waggener says. 
The brewery builds upon Waggener’s love of beer and makes a dream three-plus years in the making a reality. Its name ties to her longtime nickname — Bold Missy. 
“It’s very humbling,” she adds. 
Bold Missy will operate a 15-barrel brewhouse. 
Dan Baker has signed on as brewmaster. That role will allow Baker to put a modern twist on traditional styles. Page
